name: 公共組織理論研究
description: This master-level course is designed to provide knowledge, insights, and skills to manage and lead public organizations for students who manage public organizations in the near future. This course will examine major topics, perspectives, theories, and cases in the field of public organization. At the end of the course, students are expected to have strength to understand public organizations on both theory and practice.
goals: Understanding of key concepts in public organization theories.
Applications of theories to real-world problems.
syllabus:
1.  Introduction
2.  Overview: The Challenge of Effective Public Organization and Management
3.  Classical Approaches to Understanding Organizations
4.  Reactions, Critiques, and New Developments I
5.  Reactions, Critiques, and New Developments II
6.  What makes Public Organizations Distinctive
7.  Analyzing the Environment of Public Organizations & The Impact of Political Power and Public Policy
8.  Managing Organizational Change & Development
9.  Ethical Decision Making
10.  Current Motivation Theories: Public Service Motivation, Self Determination Theory
11.  Strengthen Service Delivery
12.  Organizational Development & Employee Training
